meanings.definition: A form of Sufi devotional music originating in South Asia.
meanings.sent1: The qawwali filled the room with spiritual melodies.
meanings.sent2: We listened to a beautiful qawwali at the concert last night.
meanings.sent3: The qawwali started playing, and everyone began swaying to the rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a qawwali, soothing and enchanting.
meanings.sent5: The qawwali echoed through the ancient mosque, touching the hearts of all who listened.

meanings.definition: A song or musical composition in the qawwali style.
meanings.sent1: He composed a new qawwali for the upcoming festival.
meanings.sent2: The qawwali they performed was a fusion of traditional and modern elements.
meanings.sent3: The children danced joyfully to the lively qawwali tune.
meanings.sent4: The qawwali played on the radio, bringing back memories of childhood.
meanings.sent5: The qawwali artist captivated the audience with his soulful performance.
